content:
• Wednesday, January 11, 2012
  • CPT

    Camden Property Trust (NYSE:CPT) drops 2.6% AH after announcing it will acquire the 80% interest...

    Camden Property Trust (NYSE:CPT) drops 2.6% AH after announcing it will acquire the 80% interest it currently doesn't own in 12 JVs involving apartment communities in the southwestern U.S for $372.1M ($99.5M in cash and the assumption/repayment of $272.6M in debt). Camden will finance the purchases by issuing 5.75M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy (LINE) announces a 17M unit secondary offering of its limited liability company...

    Linn Energy (LINE) announces a 17M unit secondary offering of its limited liability company interests. The company plans to use the proceeds to repay a portion of its revolving credit facility. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • DRWI

    Shares of DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) get hit hard in the post-trading session after its FQ3...

    Shares of DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) get hit hard in the post-trading session after its FQ3 revenue misses Street estimates. Losses widened as sales continued to slump and margins collapsed from 48% to 40%. The company also cut FQ4 revenue guidance, now projecting $12M - $15M, below analysts' expectations of $16M. Shares -12.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -14.9%), crushed today by the mere announcement of an upcoming...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -14.9%), crushed today by the mere announcement of an upcoming report from TheStreetSweeper, rises 3.3% AH after issuing a statement asserting its marketing and business practices are clean, and that it "plans to speak" with TheStreetSweeper regarding the matter.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM

  • DragonWave (DRWL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.23 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $11.8M (-56% Y/Y) misses by...

    DragonWave (DRWL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.23 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $11.8M (-56% Y/Y) misses by $1.8M. Sees Q4 revenue of $12-15M. Shares -8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • MFLX

    iPhone circuit board supplier Multi-Fineline (NASDAQ:MFLX) says it expects FQ1 revenue of $239M,...

    iPhone circuit board supplier Multi-Fineline (NASDAQ:MFLX) says it expects FQ1 revenue of $239M, well above a consensus of $215.2M. Moreover, the company, which battled Thai supply chain disruptions, expects FQ1 sales to rise Y/Y, better than a Street forecasts for a 5.5% decline. One unnamed customer accounted for 66% of FQ1 sales. iPhone chip supplier Cirrus Logic preannounced a strong Q4 on Monday.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • CVX

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) drops 1.6% AH after warning it expects its Q4 earnings to be "significantly...

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) drops 1.6% AH after warning it expects its Q4 earnings to be "significantly below" Q3 levels, thanks to its downstream business operating near breakeven. The oil giant blames the downstream weakness on lower margins and refinery input volumes, along with the absence of an asset sale. Chevron will post its Q4 report on Jan. 27. XOM -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • EXFO

    EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.03. Revenue of...

    EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $66.4M (-1.8% Y/Y) misses by $3.4M. Shares -8.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • BGFV

    Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV) falls 12.9% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $226.7M...

    Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV) falls 12.9% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $226.7M (flat Y/Y) and EPS of $0.02-$0.05, below Street estimates of $232.2M and $0.20. Same-store sales fell 2.1% Y/Y, worse than the 0.1% decline reported for Q3. Big 5 blames the weakness on unfavorable weather and "a highly promotional environment." Larger rival DKS is down 2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 2 Comments

  • Monster Beverage (MNST - formerly Hansen Natural) is announcing a 2-for-1 stock split, effective...

    Monster Beverage (MNST - formerly Hansen Natural) is announcing a 2-for-1 stock split, effective Feb. 15. A recent shareholder vote signaled such a move was on the way. Nonetheless, shares are up 1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • PVH

    PVH falls 6.3% AH after preannouncing Q4 earnings and issuing 2012 guidance. While PVH expects...

    PVH falls 6.3% AH after preannouncing Q4 earnings and issuing 2012 guidance. While PVH expects Q4 EPS of $1.08-$1.10 (above a $1.07 consensus), thanks to the strong performance of its Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger brands, its 2012 EPS guidance of $5.90-$6 is only in-line with a $5.97 consensus. A weak euro, rising pension costs, and gross margin pressure are expected to impact 2012 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • XL

    XL Group (NYSE:XL) says its preliminary loss estimates related to the floods in Thailand range...

    XL Group (NYSE:XL) says its preliminary loss estimates related to the floods in Thailand range between $135M - $185M. Shares -1.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • TSCO

    Farm store chain Tractor Supply Company (NASDAQ:TSCO) rises 4.8% AH after preannouncing Q4...

    Farm store chain Tractor Supply Company (NASDAQ:TSCO) rises 4.8% AH after preannouncing Q4 revenue of $1.24B (+20.1% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.94-$0.96, above a consensus of $1.2B and $0.86. Same-store sales rose 7.6% Y/Y (6.5% excluding the benefit of an extra sales day).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • HRC

    Medical equipment maker Hill-Rom (HRC -11.6%) tumbles after warning it expects FQ1 revenue of...

    Medical equipment maker Hill-Rom (HRC -11.6%) tumbles after warning it expects FQ1 revenue of $381M (+2% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.52-$0.53, below a consensus of $393.1M and $0.56. Moreover, citing macro weakness, Hill-Rom now expects FY12 (ends in September) revenue growth of just 2%-3% and EPS of $2.45-$2.50, below a consensus of 4.8% growth and $2.52. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • UL

    Shares of Unilever (UL -3.8%) trade lower after BofA Merrill Lynch downgraded it to Underperform...

    Shares of Unilever (UL -3.8%) trade lower after BofA Merrill Lynch downgraded it to Underperform earlier today. Merrill notes that it's one of the most expensive stocks in the consumer staples sector, trading at at 10% versus a historical discount to parity.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • RRC

    Relentlessly mild winter weather in the Northeast and the shale production boom combine to send...

    Relentlessly mild winter weather in the Northeast and the shale production boom combine to send natural gas tumbling 7.8% today to $2.77, its lowest price in a decade. Natural gas producers: RRC -6.3%, CHK -3.1%, EQT -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 9 Comments
  • T

    DirecTV (DTV +2.8%) moves higher on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation from Bernstein, saying...

    DirecTV (DTV +2.8%) moves higher on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation from Bernstein, saying the stock "simply looks too cheap." Despite the upgrade, the firm also issues a caveat of caution, saying concerns still remain over flagging subscriber growth in the U.S., shrinking margins and creeping obsolescence.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • ARNA

    Biotech firm Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -4%) dips after saying it's agreed to sell around 10M...

    Biotech firm Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -4%) dips after saying it's agreed to sell around 10M shares of its stock at $1.66, a 5.1% discount to Tuesday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • ALR

    Shares of Alere (ALR -7.7%) nosedive on heavy volume after the firm announces negative events at...

    Shares of Alere (ALR -7.7%) nosedive on heavy volume after the firm announces negative events at the JPMorgan Health Conference.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • MAS

    Building-products maker Masco's (MAS +5.4%) another beneficiary of Lennar's (LEN +6%) Q4 rise in...

    Building-products maker Masco's (MAS +5.4%) another beneficiary of Lennar's (LEN +6%) Q4 rise in new orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • SAAS

    InContact (SAAS +3.9%) moves up after saying Q4 revenues will come in at a...

    InContact (SAAS +3.9%) moves up after saying Q4 revenues will come in at a better-than-anticipated $23.5M, above analysts' estimates of $23.05M, on strength in its telecom segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CMG

    Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG +1.7%) is having another good day after providing upbeat comments at...

    Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG +1.7%) is having another good day after providing upbeat comments at an investor conference (slides/webcast). Separately, Yum Brands' (NYSE:YUM) Taco Bell unit, which has been losing share to Chipotle's costlier, higher-quality offerings, says it's looking to overhaul its menu to better compete with Chipotle. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • LEN

    A big jump in new orders booked by Lennar (LEN +7.1%) lifts up shares of the company - as well...

    A big jump in new orders booked by Lennar (LEN +7.1%) lifts up shares of the company - as well as helping ring in bold double-digit gains for peers. Ticonderoga Securities analyst Stephen East explains all the fuss: "Orders are the crown jewel in this release, up 20% to 3,027, ahead of any Street estimate we are aware of." Homebuilder advancers: KBH +14.1%, MHO +12.1%, HOV +15.8%, BZH +6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • PGHEF

    Pengrowth Energy (PGH -4%) takes a hit after Barclays cuts the stock to Underweight on...

    Pengrowth Energy (PGH -4%) takes a hit after Barclays cuts the stock to Underweight on valuation, citing its heavy LNG weighting.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU -5.9%) sells off after announcing its December traffic rose 14.3% Y/Y, trailing...

    JetBlue (JBLU -5.9%) sells off after announcing its December traffic rose 14.3% Y/Y, trailing capacity growth of 17.1%. This gap resulted in JetBlue's load factor falling to 80.2%, down 190 bps from the year-ago period. In November, JetBlue's traffic growth had soundly outpaced its capacity growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (VRA +7.3%) spikes higher after reiterating its FQ4 outlook at an investor...

    Vera Bradley (VRA +7.3%) spikes higher after reiterating its FQ4 outlook at an investor conference. (slides - PDF) (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • LEDS

    SemiLEDS (LEDS +7.4%) gains in a bout of short covering after its FQ1 beat lowered Street...

    SemiLEDS (LEDS +7.4%) gains in a bout of short covering after its FQ1 beat lowered Street estimates today. Earnings dropped 48% Y/Y, as the company says it continues to face a challenging economy, higher expenses and weaker margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • PHG

    Philips Electronics (PHG -2.5%) trades lower after Citigroup downgrades it to Sell and Exane BNP...

    Philips Electronics (PHG -2.5%) trades lower after Citigroup downgrades it to Sell and Exane BNP Paribas lowers it to Neutral, following a disappointing preliminary Q4 earnings report yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • AIZ

    Assurant (AIZ -5.1%) falls after the WSJ reports that New York's Department of Financial...

    Assurant (AIZ -5.1%) falls after the WSJ reports that New York's Department of Financial Services has launched an investigation into financial firms in the state for charging excessive fees on lapsed insurance policies.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • EMITF

    Shares of Elbit Imaging (EMITF +26.2%) skyrocket after the Israeli firm announces that it will...

    Shares of Elbit Imaging (EMITF +26.2%) skyrocket after the Israeli firm announces that it will sell 47 shopping centers in the U.S. for a cool $1.43B to a JV led by Blackstone and DDR (previous).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • SMCI

    Super Micro Computers (SMCI -6.8%) says FQ2 earnings will miss estimates due to ongoing supply...

    Super Micro Computers (SMCI -6.8%) says FQ2 earnings will miss estimates due to ongoing supply chain issues stemming from the flooding in Thailand. Earning are now expected to come in at or below $0.25 per share, below its previous projections of $0.27 and missing analysts' estimates of $0.29.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -7.8%) trades lower after Baird cuts the shares to Outperfrom on...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -7.8%) trades lower after Baird cuts the shares to Outperfrom on valuation, citing its exposure to volatile natural gas prices. The call may be just a bit late, considering the stock has already lopped off over 32% of its value since late October.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 7 Comments
  • LEA

    Automotive subsystem maker Lear (LEA -1.6%) trades lower after guiding for 2012 revenue of...

    Automotive subsystem maker Lear (LEA -1.6%) trades lower after guiding for 2012 revenue of $13.85B-$14.35B, below a $14.8B consensus. The news offsets a $300M increase in the company's stock buyback plan; Lear also has $121M remaining under a prior authorization.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG (GLNG -8%) dips after Goldman cuts the shares to Neutral from Buy on valuation and...

    Golar LNG (GLNG -8%) dips after Goldman cuts the shares to Neutral from Buy on valuation and removes it from its Conviction List. The firm cites a rise in LNG spot shipping rates and better relative value in other peer names.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • SUMR

    Child safety product manufacturer Summer Infant (SUMR -20%) tanks after lowering its FY11...

    Child safety product manufacturer Summer Infant (SUMR -20%) tanks after lowering its FY11 targets, saying its Q4 results were below expectations due to weak consumer interest, reduced retailer inventory and delays in shipping new products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • GSK

    Human Genome Sciences (HGSI +11%) pops on heavy volume. Earlier this week the biotech group said...

    Human Genome Sciences (HGSI +11%) pops on heavy volume. Earlier this week the biotech group said it expected to post 2011 sales of $59M for its new lupus drug Benlysta. Although below analysts' estimates, Piper Jaffray noted late yesterday the shares were near a bottom.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • KWT

    Solar stocks are rallying (KWT +9.3%) on hopes that module prices, which were in a freefall for...

    Solar stocks are rallying (KWT +9.3%) on hopes that module prices, which were in a freefall for nearly all of 2011, are finally stablizing. However, Solarbuzz reports module prices remain under pressure in both the U.S. and Europe. The cash burn caused by weak demand and pricing have led many to speculate weaker names will be driven out of of the market in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +4%) moves up after announcing its preliminary FY11 revenue will be ahead of...

    NuVasive (NUVA +4%) moves up after announcing its preliminary FY11 revenue will be ahead of Street views. It now expects to earn around $540M versus consensus estimates of $538M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • UCTT

    Chip equipment maker Ultra Clean (UCTT +16.5%) skyrockets after lifting its Q4 revenue guidance...

    Chip equipment maker Ultra Clean (UCTT +16.5%) skyrockets after lifting its Q4 revenue guidance to a range of $85M-$86M, above a $78.9M consensus. The company also expects its Q4 EPS to exceed a prior guidance range of $0.00-$0.02. Ultra Clean plans to report earnings on Feb. 13.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • LVS

    The Nevada Gaming Board reports (.pdf) a 7.1% spike in gambling revenue in the state for...

    The Nevada Gaming Board reports (.pdf) a 7.1% spike in gambling revenue in the state for November, with an even higher rate of 9% clocked on the Las Vegas Strip. Gaming companies with Vegas operations are posting steady gains on the day: LVS +1.4%, MGM +1.7%, WYNN +1.4%, BYD +1.7%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -10.1%) dives after TheStreetSweeper sends an e-mail to members...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -10.1%) dives after TheStreetSweeper sends an e-mail to members stating a two-part report on the company will be released, with the first segment arriving early next week. It's added that the report will raise questions about Questcor's marketing and business practices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV +9.5%) gains this morning despite issuing a cautious revenue view...

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV +9.5%) gains this morning despite issuing a cautious revenue view for 2012. Investors appear to be optimistic that the early guidance release will help discussions the company is currently holding with its bank on ammending its credit agreement.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • HEB

    Microcap drug developer Hemispherx BioPharma (HEB +16.4%) pops after being granted an extension...

    Microcap drug developer Hemispherx BioPharma (HEB +16.4%) pops after being granted an extension by the FDA for its pending New Drug Application for Ampligen, a treatment for Chronic Fatigue Syndrome.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • LOPE

    Shares of Grand Canyon Education (LOPE +4.4%) lift higher on an upgrade from BofA to Buy from...

    Shares of Grand Canyon Education (LOPE +4.4%) lift higher on an upgrade from BofA to Buy from Neutral. Analysts with the firm also took a favorable look at LOPE rival - ITT Education (ESI-OLD +1.1%) - lifting it to a Neutral rating from Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +5.8%), which was hammered last week following RF Micro's warning, is surging...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +5.8%), which was hammered last week following RF Micro's warning, is surging thanks to a bullish note from Nomura's Rick Sherlund. Sherlund is pleased with Spreadtrum's introduction of a 4G TD-LTE baseband chip, which will allow it to participate in China Mobile's (NYSE:CHL) TD-LTE trials. He also notes the Chinese chipmaker has a lower cost structure than rivals ST-Ericsson and Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • VMED

    Virgin Media (VMED +2.5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Macquarie,...

    Virgin Media (VMED +2.5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Macquarie, saying a positive Q4 report could be the catalyst to drive the stock higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • NOK

    Struggling Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +5.6%) rallies following an upgrade to Buy from Deutsche's Kai...

    Struggling Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +5.6%) rallies following an upgrade to Buy from Deutsche's Kai Korschelt, who thinks the company's financial position isn't as dire as the market believes. Korschelt believes Alcatel will have enough cash for 2012 and 2013 even if sales plummet, and think the company has a break-up value of €2/share - a 61% premium from current levels. (previously)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • EXPR

    Express (EXPR +4%) CEO Michael Weiss says the clothing chain's Q4 EPS could come in at the top...

    Express (EXPR +4%) CEO Michael Weiss says the clothing chain's Q4 EPS could come in at the top end of its forecast range of $0.66-$0.70. The retailer's holiday-season promotions didn't affect its margins to the point where it had to change its outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P +6.1%) keeps the good times rolling, trading higher again after rocking a Needham...

    Pandora (P +6.1%) keeps the good times rolling, trading higher again after rocking a Needham upgrade-inspired gain earlier this week to reach a two-month high in share price. CEO Tim Westergren adds to the festivities by telling CNBC that the firm's growth is "completely unabated."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • EFII

    Electronics for Imaging (EFII +9.1%) rallies after snapping up Cretaprint in a deal that's...

    Electronics for Imaging (EFII +9.1%) rallies after snapping up Cretaprint in a deal that's expected to add 5%-7% to EFI's top-line result. The firm issuespreliminary results for Q4 showing revenue of $163M, up 12% Y/Y and ahead of the consensus estimate of analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -5.1%) dip after the firm merely reiterates Q4 and FY11 guidance, instead...

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -5.1%) dip after the firm merely reiterates Q4 and FY11 guidance, instead of upping estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • TXT

    Shares of Textron (TXT +6.1%) trade higher after word leaks that the firm is considering spinoff...

    Shares of Textron (TXT +6.1%) trade higher after word leaks that the firm is considering spinoff options. GE is one rumored bidder, according to M&A chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • UAM

    Universal American (UAM -5.8%) agrees to buy APS Healthcare for $228M and up to $50M based on...

    Universal American (UAM -5.8%) agrees to buy APS Healthcare for $228M and up to $50M based on performance. UAM is acquiring APS from funds managed by P-E firm GTCR. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • IVAN

    Shares of Ivanhoe Energy (NASDAQ:IVAN) soar, up 22.1% premarket, after the firm announces that...

    Shares of Ivanhoe Energy (NASDAQ:IVAN) soar, up 22.1% premarket, after the firm announces that it sold its interest in China's Zitong Block to a Royal Dutch Shell subsidiary for up to $160M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • HL

    Hecla Mining (HL -15%) plummets after cutting its 2012 silver production outlook to 7M ounces...

    Hecla Mining (HL -15%) plummets after cutting its 2012 silver production outlook to 7M ounces from 9.5M as the Mine Safety and Health Administration orders the closure of a shaft at its Lucky Friday silver mine, where activity has been halted since November. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market preview: Green premarket yesterday, U.S. futures and EU stocks are red this morning...

    Market preview: Green premarket yesterday, U.S. futures and EU stocks are red this morning following Fitch's warning of cataclysm for the euro, although falling German GDP can't be helping either. S&P futures -0.25%. SuperValu is terrible value, diving 10% following its earnings miss. Textron +4.7% after it says its conducting a strategic review. Later: Fed's Beige Book, Fed's Plosser.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • KODK

    Premarket gainers: EK +15%. YOKU +8%. CROX +7%. ALU +6%. TXT +5%. DECK +4%. ING +3%. BRCD +3%....

    Premarket gainers: EK +15%. YOKU +8%. CROX +7%. ALU +6%. TXT +5%. DECK +4%. ING +3%. BRCD +3%. VICL +3%. IDIX +3%.
    Losers: URBN -17%. HL -15%. SVU -9%. CMC -6%. ARNA -6%. CMVT -6%. RGLD -4%. RDS.A -3%. TWO -3%. SKM -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • AABA

    Shares of Yahoo (YHOO) edge higher, up 1% premarket, on the news that Alibaba (OTC:ALBCF) needs...

    Shares of Yahoo (YHOO) edge higher, up 1% premarket, on the news that Alibaba (OTC:ALBCF) needs to borrow less to buy back its YHOO-owned stake. The disclosure is an important one with Alibaba's status as a holding company making it trickier to obtain financing.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • ROK

    Rockwell Automation (NYSE:ROK) gains 1.8% premarket after the firm lands an upgrade from Nomura...

    Rockwell Automation (NYSE:ROK) gains 1.8% premarket after the firm lands an upgrade from Nomura to Buy from Neutral. The new price target of $87 set by analysts marks a $10 hike and reps 16% upside for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • SVU

    More on SuperValu (NYSE:SVU) earnings: FY'12 EPS guidance excluding impairment charges of...

    More on SuperValu (NYSE:SVU) earnings: FY'12 EPS guidance excluding impairment charges of $1.20-1.30 vs. consensus of $1.10-1.30; Revenue guidance of $36.1B vs. consensus of $36.1-37.1B. Same-store sales growth seen at -2.5-3%. Shares, now -3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • SVU

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $8.3B (-4.3% Y/Y) misses by...

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $8.3B (-4.3% Y/Y) misses by $120M. Shares -4.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • CMC

    Bloomberg reports Carl Icahn has ended his attempt to purchase Commercial Metals...

    Bloomberg reports Carl Icahn has ended his attempt to purchase Commercial Metals (NYSE:CMC).Shares -10.5% premarket. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • WBMD

    After yesterday's action in which WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) lost about 25% of its value, Morgan...

    After yesterday's action in which WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) lost about 25% of its value, Morgan Stanley cuts the stock to underweight. Thanks, guys. Shares -1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 AM

  • The euro dives below $1.27 and European shares are down alongside with some crediting Fitch's...

    The euro dives below $1.27 and European shares are down alongside with some crediting Fitch's comments with spooking the markets. The Stoxx 50 gives up gains of about 0.5%, now -1.1%. The euro is back within a handful of pips of a 16-month low, -0.7% at $1.2688.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 AM
  • BLK

    BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) issues a correction, saying it still holds a 3.09% stake in UniCredit...

    BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) issues a correction, saying it still holds a 3.09% stake in UniCredit (OTCPK:UNCFF). BlackRock's mistaken statement on Dec. 27 that it had cut its holdings to 1.71% helped prompt a massive sell-off in the Italian bank. UniCredit +4% in Italy.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 AM
